_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The oneness dependent on different perce: Perception of the dimension of infinite space
Perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness
Perception of the dimension of nothingness
The understanding of emptiness (a causal: They regard it as empty of what is not there
As to what remains they understand that it is present
That’s how emptiness is born in them—genuine, undistorted, and pure.
The understanding of the mendicant who f: They understand that even this signless immersion of the heart is produced by choices and intentions
They understand that whatever is produced by choices and intentions is impermanent and liable to cessation
Their mind is freed from the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance
Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.
The training of Ānanda (a causal sequenc: Ānanda should train to enter and remain in the pure, ultimate, supreme emptiness.
